# gleanr

The goal of gleanr is to provide the core code for actually performing the factorization work. blah blah blah.

## Installation

You can install the development version of gleanr from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("aomdahl/gleanr/gleanr"")
```

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example}

## basic example code
```
